meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of primitivism.
meanings.sent1: The tribal art displayed a primitivistic style, with its raw and unrefined forms.
meanings.sent2: Her primitivistic approach to painting focused on using earthy tones and basic shapes.
meanings.sent3: The primitivistic decor in the restaurant gave it a cozy and rustic feel.
meanings.sent4: His primitivistic music echoed the simplicity and purity of nature's sounds.
meanings.sent5: The primitivistic design of the house embraced natural materials and minimalistic elements.

meanings.definition: Advocating or reflecting a belief in the superiority of a simple way of life.
meanings.sent1: The primitivistic philosophy emphasized the joy of living close to nature and away from modern complexities.
meanings.sent2: She admired the primitivistic lifestyle of the indigenous tribe, free from the distractions of technology.
meanings.sent3: In his primitivistic way, he preferred to cook over an open fire rather than use a stove.
meanings.sent4: The primitivistic values of the community centered around self-sufficiency and harmony with the environment.
meanings.sent5: Living in a primitivistic cabin deep in the woods, he found peace in simplicity and solitude.
